member.name: T:SharpHook.EventSimulator
member.summary: A keyboard and mouse event simulator which posts events to the OS.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateKeyPress(SharpHook.Native.KeyCode,SharpHook.Native.ModifierMask)
member.summary: Simulates pressing a key.
member.param: The code of the key to press.
The modifier mask of the event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateKeyRelease(SharpHook.Native.KeyCode,SharpHook.Native.ModifierMask)
member.summary: Simulates releasing a key.
member.param: The code of the key to release.
The modifier mask of the event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateMousePress(SharpHook.Native.MouseButton,SharpHook.Native.ModifierMask)
member.summary: Simulates pressing a mouse button.
member.param: The modifier mask of the event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateMouseRelease(SharpHook.Native.MouseButton,SharpHook.Native.ModifierMask)
member.summary: Simulates releasing a mouse button.
member.param: The modifier mask of the event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateMouseMovement(System.Int16,System.Int16,SharpHook.Native.ModifierMask)
member.summary: Simulates moving a mouse pointer.
member.param: The target X-coordinate of the mouse pointer.
The target Y-coordinate of the mouse pointer.
The modifier mask of the event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateMouseWheel(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.UInt16,System.Int16,SharpHook.Native.ModifierMask)
member.summary: Simulates scrolling a mouse wheel.
member.param: The target X-coordinate of the mouse pointer.
The target Y-coordinate of the mouse pointer.
The modifier mask of the event.

remarks.para: A positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user.
Mouse wheel simulation is a little inconsistent across platforms, and not documented. View the source code of libuiohook for more details.

member.name: T:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase
member.summary: Represents an abstract implementation of which raises events only when there is at least one subscriber.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.Finalize
member.summary: Destroys the global hook if it's running.

member.name: P:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the global hook is running.
member.value: if the global hook is running. Otherwise, .

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.Run
member.summary: Runs the global hook on the current thread, blocking it. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.RunAsync
member.summary: Runs the global hook without blocking the current thread. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.returns: A which finishes when the hook is destroyed.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.
member.remarks: The hook is started on a separate thread.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.Dispose
member.summary: Destroys the global hook.
member.remarks: After calling this method, the hook cannot be started again. If you want to do that, create a new instance of .

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.HandleHookEvent(SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent@)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, represents a strategy for handling a hook event.
member.remarks: Derived classes should call inside this method to raise the appropriate event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.DispatchEvent(SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent@)
member.summary: Dispatches an event from libuiohook, i.e. raises the appropriate event.

member.name: T:SharpHook.IGlobalHook
member.summary: Represents a global keyboard and mouse hook.

member.name: P:SharpHook.IGlobalHook.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the global hook is running.
member.value: if the global hook is running. Otherwise, .

member.name: M:SharpHook.IGlobalHook.Run
member.summary: Runs the global hook on the current thread, blocking it. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.IGlobalHook.RunAsync
member.summary: Runs the global hook without blocking the current thread. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.returns: A which finishes when the hook is destroyed.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.
member.remarks: Since the underlying native API for running a global hook is blocking, the only way to run it without blocking the current thread is to run it on a separate thread.

member.name: T:SharpHook.Native.UioHook
member.summary: Contains native methods of libuiohook.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.EmptyDispatchProc
member.summary: An empty hook callback function.
member.value: A hook callback function which does nothing.
member.remarks: You can use this function to "unset" a hook callback function.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.SetDispatchProc(SharpHook.Native.DispatchProc)
member.summary: Sets the hook callback function.
member.param: The function to call when an event is raised.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.Run
member.summary: Runs the global hook and blocks the thread until it's stopped.
member.returns: The result of the operation.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.Stop
member.summary: Stops the global hook.
member.returns: The result of the operation.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.PostEvent(SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent@)
member.summary: Posts a fake input event.

remarks.para:
The following table describes the specifics of simulating each event type.
Event type Description
Events of this type are ignored.
Events of this type are ignored.
Only is considered.
Only is considered.
Not recommended to use since on some platforms events of this type are ignored, while on others they are not.
Only is considered.
Only is considered.
Not recommended to use since on some platforms events of this type are ignored, while on others they are not.
Only and are considered.
Not recommended to use; instead, use with a modifier mask.
Only , , , and are considered.
Mouse wheel simulation is a little inconsistent across platforms, and not documented. View the source code of libuiohook for more details.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.CreateScreenInfo(System.Byte@)
member.summary: Gets the information about screens.
member.returns: The information about screens as an unmanaged array of whose length is returned as .
member.remarks: You should use instead as it returns a managed array.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.CreateScreenInfo
member.summary: Gets the information about screens.
member.returns: The information about screens.
member.remarks: This is the safe version of as it returns a managed array.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.GetAutoRepeatRate
member.summary: Gets the auto-repeat rate.
member.returns: The auto-repeat rate.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.GetAutoRepeatDelay
member.summary: Gets the auto-repeat delay.
member.returns: The auto-repeat delay.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.GetPointerAccelerationMultiplier
member.summary: Gets the pointer acceleration multiplier.
member.returns: The pointer acceleration multiplier.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.GetPointerAccelerationThreshold
member.summary: Gets the pointer acceleration threshold.
member.returns: The pointer acceleration threshold.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.GetPointerSensitivity
member.summary: Gets the pointer sensitivity.
member.returns: The pointer sensitivity.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Native.UioHook.GetMultiClickTime
member.summary: Gets the multi-click time.
member.returns: The multi-click time.

member.summary: Represents an event which can be raised by libuiohook.

The field is available for the events of the following types:
The field is available for the events of the following types:

member.summary: The type of the event.

member.summary: The time of the event which should be used only to compare it to times of other events.
member.value: The time of the event which should be used only to compare it to times of other events.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent.Mask
member.summary: The mask of the event.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent.Reserved
member.summary: The reserved value which can be set in event handlers.

member.remarks: The value for this field should be set on the same thread which handles the event.

member.name: T:SharpHook.SimpleGlobalHook
member.summary: Represents an implementation of which raises events on the same thread on which the hook itself runs.
member.remarks: The event handlers should generally be fast and simple so that the thread can process all raised events. If you need to do a lot of processing in the event handlers then consider using another implementation, e.g. .

member.name: M:SharpHook.SimpleGlobalHook.HandleHookEvent(SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent@)
member.summary: Handles the hook event.

member.name: T:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook
member.summary: Represents a task pool-based implementation of .

remarks.para: The event handlers will run with the specified parallelism level on separate threads inside the default thread pool for tasks. This is done so that the hook itself will not be blocked if the handlers are long-running. The exception is the event which will run on the same thread that called the method since at that point it doesn't matter anymore that the hook is not blocked.
Setting of inside the handlers will have no effect as they are run in other threads.

member.name: M:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.remarks: Calling this constructor is the same as passing to the other constructor.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The options of the hook which include its parallelism level.

member.summary: Handles the hook event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Destoys the global hook.
member.param: if the method is called from the method. Otherwise, .
member.remarks: After calling this method, the hook cannot be started again. If you want to do that, create a new instance of .
